description: The round payoff this round was 88. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of 14.67.

The game resembles a coordination problem with two Nash equilibria: mutual cooperation (option 1) and mutual defection (option 2). Mutual cooperation yields higher payoffs, but mutual defection is also a stable outcome if players lack trust or coordination.

The structure of payoffs creates a scenario where players might end up in a suboptimal equilibrium (mutual defection) if they cannot coordinate on the mutually beneficial strategy (mutual cooperation).
The game highlights the importance of trust and communication in repeated interactions, as the potential for higher payoffs through cooperation is undermined by the risk of unilateral defection.
